DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services for any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting of measurement of serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase, serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase or alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services for any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting of measurement of serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase, serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase or alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.:Activity measured as a test of liver function, 46/47-kDa homodimeric human Aspartate Aminotransferases (Class-I Pyridoxal-Phosphate-Dependent Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. (NCI):Activity measured as a test of liver function, human Glutamic-Pyruvate Transaminases (Alanine Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Glutamic Pyruvic Transaminases mediate conversion of major intermediate metabolites, catalyzing reversible transamination between alanine and alpha-ketoglutarate to form pyruvate and glutamate. (NCI):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. Aspartate aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-aspartate to alpha-ketoglutarate forming oxaloacetate and L-glutamate.

A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Alanine aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-alanine to alpha-ketoglutarate forming pyruvate and L-glutamate.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are the AST(SGOT) and ALT(SGP
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the AST(SGOT) and ALT(SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 times the institutional upper limit of normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the SGOT (AST), SGPT (ALT) and Alkaline Phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the AST, ALT, and Alkaline Phosphatase less than or equal to 3 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST (SGOT) / ALT (SGPT) <= 2.0 x upper limit of normal within 7 days prior to first dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the SGOT/AST and Alkaline Phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 times the upper limit of normal in the absence of liver metastasis OR are the SGOT/AST and Alkaline Phosphatase less than 5.0 times the ULN in the presence of liver metastasis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the SGOT (AST), SGPT (ALT) and Alkaline Phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: AST(SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) <= 5.0 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) within 14 days prior to registration on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT (SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal if liver involvement?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT (SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal if liver involvement?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the AST/ALT less than or equal to 2.5 the institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Are AST and ALT less than or equal to 3 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serum AST and/or ALT > 3 X upper limit of institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's SGPT (ALT) less than or equal to 3 times the upper limits of normal?
